#Introduction of the Terms in this project

= Conflict Number =
Conflict Number is a number that representing the effect of selecting a session of a course. This value is the number of course (if there are at least one session conflict with the current session, this value will +1) that *could not* be selected *LATER*.

== Example ==
{{{
CS0001 TEST1 5
C01 Fri 1200 1400 AC1 LT6 10001 3
C02 Mon 1100 1300 AC1 LT8 10002 3 
C03 Wed 2000 2200 AC1 LT7 10003 3 
C04 Mon 0900 1100 AC1 LT3 10004 3 
C05 Fri 1500 1700 AC1 LT2 10005 3

CS0002 TEST2 5
C01 Fri 1200 1300 AC1 LT6 20001 3
C02 Mon 1200 1300 AC1 LT6 20002 3
C03 Tue 1200 1300 AC1 LT6 20003 3
C04 Wed 1200 1300 AC1 LT6 20004 3
C05 Thu 1200 1300 AC1 LT6 20005 3

CS0003 TEST3 5
CA1 Fri 1200 1400 AC1 LT6 30001 3
CA2 Mon 1100 1300 AC1 LT8 30002 3 
CA3 Wed 1800 2000 AC1 LT7 30003 3 
CA4 Mon 0900 1100 AC1 LT3 30004 3 
CA5 Fri 1500 1700 AC1 LT2 30005 3

CS0004 TEST4 1
C01 Tue 0900 1200 AC2 2550 40001 3

CS0005 TEST5 3
C01 Wed 0900 1300 AC2 2550 50001 3
C01 Mon 1700 1900 AC2 2550 50001 3
C01 Mon 1500 1700 AC2 2550 50001 3

CS0006 TEST6 1
C01 Fri 1200 1400 AC2 2550 60001 3
}}}
For CS0001 - C01, it conflict Number = 3 (conflicted with CS0002 - C01, CS0003 - C01 & CS0006-C01)
*if curr section conflict with any session of a single course, it Confilct number will +1*
For CS0002 - C01, it conflict Number = 2 (conflicted with CS0003 - C01 & CS0006-C01)
*the conflict number ONLY consider the course that having lower priority than the current course*
